body.p:
Spring Station
12 June 1861 Ky
G. W. Johnson Esqre
Georgetown
Scott Co
Dear Sir

Your note of 10th inst is recd also one of previous date in subject of Commercial Bank stock. I found on inquiry that the Bank Stock would not be sold at any price & as money ^with which^ to pay what I owe is what I want it will not suit the purpose required I do not know that the Banks or any one of them are taking any paper just now & if this is the case I had as soon hold your note as Mr. Thomas' note_If you find that you can dispose of his note or Bill to any Bank it should be done by all means; I would be willing to lose a small per cent to get the cash, myself
If you could arrange to pay me a portion of the Amt due it would aid me just now, as I am really requiring money to meet my engagements --

I am Yours Very Truly
R. Aitcheson Alexander

P.S.
I send your Mr. Thomas' letters (or rather two of them.) You sent me to see I think I have a third wh I will look up & hand you if it is needed. I should have written to you before but thought that I should meet you & so put off writing=
